utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Phoebe?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Look at that guy by the window, wow!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: He’s awfully short and I think he’s talking to himself. And to be completely honest, he’s not that good in bed.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, what is wrong with me lately? I mean it’s like every guy I see—I mean look here. Look at that guy for example, I mean normally that’s not someone I would-would be attracted too, but right now, with the way I’m feeling, all I want to do is rip off his sweatpants and fanny pack.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wait a second! This is about the forth month of your pregnancy right?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: This is completely normal, around the forth month your hormones start going crazy.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Really?! So this has happened to you?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh absolutely yeah! Oh and keep in mind now, I was carrying triplets so in, y’know, medical terms I was-I was thrice as randy.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wow! This explains so much! Last weekend, I went from store to store sitting on Santa’s lap.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah, I remember trying to steal a cardboard cutout of Evander Holyfield from a Foot Locker.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ah.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, y’know what? I go see my doctor tomorrow I’ll ask her about this. Maybe she can give me a pill or something.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah, that’s what you need a good…pill.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Hey! Hey!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Hi! Look! I got our pictures developed from Rockefeller Center.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh great! Hey-hey Joey, do you want to check out pictures of me and Mona ice skating?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh uh, ordinarily I would love too, but I am just swamped right now.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey where-where are the pictures that creepy pretzel vendor took of us together?

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Oh yeah, probably at the end. Oh my God! He only took pictures of my breasts!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I’m missin’ picture time?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Y’know she has a face Ross!

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Okay. Okay, here’s a good one of us.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Wow! That is a good one! Wow, it looks like a, like a holiday card y’know, with the tree in the middle and the skaters and the snow.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Y’know, every year I say I’m gonna send out holiday cards and I never do it. Do you wanna, do you wanna send this one out together?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Together? Like-like to people?

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Yeah, y’know. Happy holidays from Mona and Ross. It’ll be cute, okay?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Oh, I gotta get to work. So call me later?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh sure, sure.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Bye guys.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Congratulations! You just got married!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I know. Can you believe that?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wait, I’m-I’m sorry. What’s the big deal about a holiday card?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Married couples send out cards, families send out cards, people who have been dating for a couple of months do not send out cards! What-what is she crazy?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey-hey-hey, hey that’s your wife you’re talking about!

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: Bing! Ho! And the Bing-ette!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Honey, you remember my boss Doug right?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yes, hi.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: Hi. So good news, the divorce is final. I signed the papers this A.M.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I didn’t know you and Carol were getting divorced, I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: Sorry? Finally chewed my leg out of that bear trap. Hey, congratulations to you guys though!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No leg chewing for us sir.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: Oh well, give it time. So the divorce, the marriage, we’ve got a lot to celebrate. How about we all go out to dinner tomorrow night?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I can’t think of anything we’re doing. Why can’t I think of anything we’re doing?

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: Tomorrow night it is then, I should be out of court by six. They keep throwing these sexual harassment cases at me and I keep knocking them out of the park!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, I’ll see you tomorrow! Just so you know, we’re not seeing him tomorrow. I-I cannot spend another evening with that man. Do you remember how he behaved at our wedding?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That’s because he wasn’t invited because of the way he behaved at our engagement party.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh yeah. Boy, urine cuts right through an ice sculpture doesn’t it?

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Hey, I went by the photo shop, take a look, here is a mockup of our card. What do you think?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Huh. Wow, this is great.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Now, do you think it should say, "Love Ross and Mona?"

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, we-we haven’t said that to each other yet, but I guess its okay to say it to other people.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: How many did you want? I’m getting a hundred.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: A hundred?! Well, I-I guess I’ll take a—Mona, uh…I-I’m not sure about the whole uh, card thing.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Really? Why not?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Sending out a holiday card, together, I mean I just don’t know if we’re really quite there yet.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Oh y’know, I didn’t think of it that way. You’re right. You’re right. So, can I ask you a question?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Where are we?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Huh.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Y’know, like where are we? Where is this relationship going?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hmm…

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: I mean I love spending time with you, y’know I just—I hope we’re moving forward. I mean, we should probably talk about that. Don’t you think?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Let’s do the card!

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: The card! I think we’re there!

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Okay. I—But I think we should still have this conversation.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Really?! I mean, even with the card?

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: Just so you know, Dr. Long can’t be here today, she was called to the hospital, so Dr. Schiff will be seeing you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, okay. Hey, can I ask you a question? Was it me, or-or was the guy who took my blood sample really cute? Y’know who I’m talking about, bald haircut, hairy fingers…

utterance.speaker: Dr. Schiff
utterance.content: Hi Rachel? I’m Dr. Schiff.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes, you are.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Schiff
utterance.content: So, how’s it going?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, really, really good. But enough about me, come on! Where-where are you from? What do you do?

utterance.speaker: Dr. Schiff
utterance.content: I’m a doctor.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Right! Right! I-I actually meant in your spare time, do you cook? Do you ski? Or do you just hang out with your wife or girlfriend?

utterance.speaker: Dr. Schiff
utterance.content: Uh, I don’t have a wife or girlfriend, but I do like to ski.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, I love to ski! How amazing is this?!

utterance.speaker: Dr. Schiff
utterance.content: So, are you experiencing any discomfort?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No. I’m very comfortable.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Schiff
utterance.content: Any painful gas?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No! Shoot, Dr. Schiff what kind of question is that?!

utterance.speaker: Dr. Schiff
utterance.content: Okay then, would you like to lie down on the table?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well would you like me to lie down on the table?

utterance.speaker: Dr. Schiff
utterance.content: I’m sorry, is there something going on here?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Do you feel it too?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh hey! So, how did your doctor’s appointment go?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, let’s see. Uh, they gave me cute doctor today and in the middle of the exam I put my pinky in his chin dimple.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Why did you do that?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, remember that little problem I was having during my forth month of pregnancy?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh yeah, the Evander Holyfield phase. Oh man you were so hard up you practically came on to me.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You wish.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey, I could’ve had you if I wanted you.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh yeah? Come and get it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, even this is turning me on!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh hey! Hey Ross! Hey how’s it, how’s it going with you and Mona? Are you guys still together?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh yeah, yeah we’re moving forward. You’ll be getting our card!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You and Mona are doing a holiday card together?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, we’re not just doing a card! Y’know, she-she also wants to have the conversation about where the relationship is going.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ugh! Women!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I know! I know! Why do you guys need to have this conversation?! Huh? I mean no self-respecting man would ask a woman, "So, where is this going?"

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Uh Ross? You asked me that.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey! You were a closed book! Okay? I’m not a mind reader! Besides, I hate those conversations. I’m horrible at them. Really! Maybe-maybe I need kind of a gesture. Y’know, something that says we’re moving forward without having to talk about it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Like asking her to move in with you?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Smaller than that.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Making her a mixed tape?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh, bigger than that.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Give her a key to your apartment.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Whoa-hello! We were closer with the mixed tape.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right. Have you said, "I love you?" You could say, I love you.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah I-I don’t-I don’t think I’m quite there yet, but I could say I looove spending time with you.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, we hate that.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That is a slap in the face.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Forget it. I-I—Y’know what? I’ll just have the conversation. I’ll just say I like things the way they are, and hope for the best. What do you think Rach?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I think, if it was a little colder in here I could see your nipples through that sweater.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: Bing! We’re all set for tonight, 8 o’clock.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh uh, as it turns out, we can’t do it. Monica has to work.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: Oh, my ex-wife didn’t work, unless you call turning into her mother work. Fine. Tomorrow night then.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh uh well tomorrow’s no good for her either.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: Oh? Why not?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It’s the semi-finals…of her…botchy ball tournament.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: What’s going on Bing? Does uh, your wife have a problem with me or something?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well now-now you’re just talking crazy.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: So why can’t the three of us go out together?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Because uh…we-we…we split up. Monica and I split up. Hold me.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: Good God Bing I…well I can’t say I’m altogether surprised, I saw the way she looked at you, and there was no love there. And the way she looked at me, pure lust.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Y’know what would really help me through this tough time is choking something. Can I choke ya?

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: Bing my boy, we’re gonna get you over this. Now here’s the plan, grab your coat, we’re going to a strip club.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh no-no-no, Monica would freak. But to hell with that bitch.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Here we go. Mona umm, I think it’s time we-we had a conversation about-about where things are with us.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Yeah, I-I think I suggested that.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Aw, we-we are so… So umm, well I-I-I like you and I-I love umm, y’know hanging out with you. And I mean-I’m having a lot of fun.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I mean, there’s no point in spending time with someone if-if it’s just fun. It’s gotta be, it’s gotta be going somewhere right? So where-where is it going? Ah! That’s-that’s the real question. And-and the answer is…is it’s going somewhere…fun. Now I-I know what you’re thinking, fun was fine for you like ten years ago y’know, but you’re-you’re not getting any younger. No I mean—No not you, not you, you—you are getting younger. I mean—you-you look like you’re getting younger by the second—What’s your secret?

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: I’m sorry, so umm, so where are we?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, well to sum up, we’re having fun, you look young.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Okay…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: But that’s not enough. So… So…here’s a key to my apartment.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Really?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Really.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: You don’t think this is too fast.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You gave her a key to your apartment?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Not just a key, I gave her the only key! I am now a homeless person in a very serious relationship.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey. Ooh Ross! How’d the conversation go?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh great, I live on the street.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Where?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hi! Okay, Monica, Rachel, this is my friend Roger.

utterance.speaker: Roger
utterance.content: Hey everybody.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hi Roger.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So umm, I’m gonna get us some drinks. Would you help me out?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Umm, he’s here to have sex with you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You’re welcome.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Phoebe no!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: It’s okay, he’s a virgin.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Rachel umm, I was just talking to this guy and I think he’ll have sex with you.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, okay let’s leave these two alone.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No! I do not care what my hormones are doing, I am not going to just do it with some random guy!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Fine! Then you tell Roger because he was really looking forward to this!

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: Oh Bing, look at those twin sisters dancing together. Let me buy you a lap dance with those girls. Huh?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh that’s all right sir, and that’s just one girl.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: Bing—What’s this?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It’s a hand. It’s a thing you use as a Jack and Coke holder.

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: No, it’s a wedding ring. You gotta get rid of it. We’re gonna go to the East River right now and throw it in there!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh no-no-no!

utterance.speaker: Doug
utterance.content: Oh yeah-yeah-yeah, y’know I did it and I felt a hell of a lot better and if you whip it just right you might hit a seagull in the head.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, and oh I’m gonna need a bunch of extra keys. Apparently I give them away for no reason at all.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Hey Ross, what’s going on? You changing the lock?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No. That guy is.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: I don’t understand. You-you give me a key to your apartment and then you change the lock.

utterance.speaker: Locksmith
utterance.content: Good luck buddy.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Umm, I-I thought we were moving forward and now you’re-you’re sending me all these mixed signals. What are you trying to tell me?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I’m trying to tell you I made you a mix tape.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I love you!

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Ohh! And I love spending time with you.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hi honey I’m home.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: From the tequila factory?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It was awful. To get out of going to dinner with Doug I told him that you and I split up. So then he took me to all these strip clubs and sleazy bars, and then when I wouldn’t give him my wedding ring, he threw a soda can at a bird!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Come here. I can breath throw my mouth.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Y’know what the worse part was? I got to see what my life would be like without you. It was like It’s a Wonderful Life with lap dances. Please promise that you will never leave me, that we will grow old together, and be with each other for the rest of our lives.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I promise. Hey, speaking of together, how about we send out a holiday card this year?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ooh, I don’t know if we’re there yet.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes. Hi, I’d like to order a pizza. Okay, can I ask you a question? Is-is the cute blond guy delivering tonight? Very Ambocrombie Fitch. I’ll call you back.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Who was that?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: It’s just the pizza place.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You hung up on the pizza place? I don’t hang up on your friends.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I’m sorry honey, I’m just having a, having a rough day.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, what’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh you really, you really just don’t want to hear about it.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Then why did I ask?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, it’s just—and this is really embarrassing—but lately with this whole pregnancy thing I’m just finding myself…how do I put this umm, erotically charged.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Is that college talk for horny?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah. So y’know, I have all of these feelings and I don’t know what to do about them, because I can’t date like a normal person, which is fine because I don’t need a relationship, I mean all I really want is one great night. Just sex, y’know? No strings attached, no relationship, just with someone that I feel comfortable with and who knows what he’s doing. For just one great night, I mean is that really so…hard…to find. So how was your day?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Good, I uh, I saw a pretty big pigeon.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, I gotta get up early and it’s almost seven o’clock.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, I gotta, I gotta go to my room to.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, good night!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Good night.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I can’t do it!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I didn’t ask you to do it!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You’re Rachel!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You’re Joey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You’re my friend!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Right back at ya!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: But plus it would be wrong and weird and-and-and bad.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And so bad. I don’t even know what you’re talking about because I didn’t ask you to do anything!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I know!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Do you wanna do it?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right, me neither! I was just testing you!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: That’s the end of this conversation!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: This conversation never happened!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Never happened! Good night!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Good night!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Get back in there!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hi. Listen, I’m sorry about that whole thing with Roger. It really wasn’t right, and I, and I want to make it up to you, so umm, I brought you something that I think you’ll really enjoy. Now, this is just a loan. Okay? I’m gonna, I’m gonna want him back. So… I’m gonna go now. I’m sorry, I thought I could do it and I can’t!
